channel.title: RNZ New Zealand Headlines
channel.description: The Latest New Zealand headlines from RNZ News

item.title: Trapped migrant workers - NZ's new underclass
item.description: The Detail - A new underclass is emerging in the Covid-19 era of migrants who no longer have any work and can't get home and temporary visa holders trapped outside the borders.

item.title: Earthquake shakes East Coast of North Island
item.description: A magnitude 5.1 earthquake has struck the East Coast of the North Island.

item.title: Police officer who slapped teenager during youth programme keeps job
item.description: An off-duty police officer who slapped a 15-year-old girl while he was leading a youth programme has kept his job.

item.title: Waikato's refugee community champion dies of Covid-19
item.description: Voices - Waikato's refugee and Muslim communities lost one of their prominent leaders, Ismail Dirye Gamadid, to Covid-19 last month.

item.title: Inquest into death of man in police cell resumes
item.description: A coronial inquest into the death of a young man in an Auckland police cell more than six years ago is under way again.

item.title: Archbishop of Wellington rejects 'all lives matter' message at church
item.description: The Archbishop of Wellington has condemned a sign reading 'All lives matter' that was displayed outside a Catholic church in Masterton over the weekend.

item.title: Waikato council slams Watercare planning as Auckland mayor Goff warns of crisis
item.description: Auckland has been warned it cannot rely on the Waikato River alone to get it out of a drought-induced water supply crisis.

item.title: Man arrested after home burglary involving a gun
item.description: A Wairarapa resident was woken about 1.30am on Saturday morning was confronted in their hallway by four people, one with a gun and another with a hammer.

item.title: Hackers targeting working from home security flaws - CERT
item.description: Cyber criminals are targeting companies with employees working from home, with remote access in many cases lacking sufficient security.

item.title: Mental health units appeared successful in lockdown - Chief Ombudsman
item.description: Mental health units did well during the Covid-19 lockdown, the chief ombudsman says, but he concedes his report may be inaccurate because the facilities were forewarned of inspection.

item.title: Union urges government to honour living wage promise to contract workers
item.description: A union is calling on the government, on behalf of its contracted essential workers, to fulfill its previous election pledge to them.

item.title: Council organisation defends work on New Brighton
item.description: A Christchurch council organisation set up to promote regeneration of earthquake-damaged areas is defending its work to revitalise the seaside suburb of New Brighton.

item.title: Covid-19: Streak continues with no new cases for 24 days in a row
item.description: New Zealand has no new cases of Covid-19 for the 24th day in a row and one significant cluster has now closed, the Ministry of Health has confirmed.

item.title: More calls for NZ to include Cook Islands in bubble
item.description: The Aotearoa Society of the Cook Islands has joined the call for New Zealand to open up its borders to allow travel with south Pacific nations that are free of Covid-19.

item.title: First weekend at level 1 draws crowds to rugby - and emergency rooms
item.description: The first weekend at alert level 1 drew massive crowds of rugby fans to matches in Auckland and Dunedin - but hospital emergency departments across the country also felt the impact of the return to normality.

item.title: Covid-19: Siouxsie Wiles on virus elimination
item.description: It's been 28 days since the last case of community transmission of Covid-19 ended quarantine.

item.title: 'A deathly silence': New Brighton residents fume over agency's lack of action
item.description: A Christchurch residents' group is calling on the council to dump the regeneration group currently tasked with the job of revamping their local shopping area.

item.title: False advertising over Covid-19 cures targeted by Commerce Commission
item.description: The Commerce Commission has fielded 67 complaints about traders falsely advertising products as protecting against the coronavirus.
